item.title: Operator Algebras Modeling Dynamics of Frames
item.description: For a Hilbert space $\mathscr{H}$, $y \in \mathscr{H}$ and $T \in \mathscr{B}(\mathscr{H})$, the equation \begin{equation} T x = y \end{equation} has a solution whenever $T$ is left invertible. For any left inverse $L$ of $T$, $x = L y$ is a solution. More generally, if $T$ has closed range, $T$ has a pseudo left inverse. Concretely, if $T \in \mathscr{B}(\mathscr{H})$ has closed range, restricting to $\ker(T)^\perp$ we obtain a new operator that is left invertible.
